featured.text: The construction of the Going-to-the-Sun Road was a huge task.
Construction began when the first cornerstone was laid in October of 1792.
The young generation in this country has shown less interest in factory work and other _____ labor jobs, such as house construction and fruit picking.
The non-profit organization has _____ $1 million over five years to finance the construction of the medical center.
Since its introduction in the early 20th century, the headgear has saved countless lives and is considered the number one safety tool for construction workers.

other.text: In fact, there is documented 22 to the ringing of bells even before the cathedral’s construction was completed, dating as far back as the 12th century.
The headgear was later made mandatory at construction sites in major construction projects, such as the Hoover Dam in 1931 and the Golden Gate Bridge in 1933.
The construction of the road has changed the way visitors experience the Glacier National Park.
What does “an engineering feat” mean? (A) A big success in construction.
Who initiated the construction of the White House? (A) John Adams.
Although President Washington oversaw the construction of the house, he never lived in it.

definition.zh_def: 建築；建設的過程或行為。
definition.en_def: The process or act of building something, typically structures such as buildings or roads.
definition.example: The construction of the new bridge will take two years to complete.
